intro: Ageratum houstonianum f. normale, commonly known as the common ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers in shades of blue, purple, white, and pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is hairy and gray-green, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and floral arrangements due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
